item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (336 points | 99 comments)
2. Dog Aging Project (16 points | 1 comment)
3. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (160 points | 47 comments)
4. U.S. Army Soldier Arrested in AT&T, Verizon Extortions (6 points | discuss)
5. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (173 points | 57 comments)
6. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (251 points | 149 comments)
7. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (52 points | 5 comments)
8. Seyfert Galaxies (13 points | discuss)
9. "A Course of Pure Mathematics" – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (192 points | 39 comments)
10. Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (92 points | 24 comments)
11. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (25 points | 5 comments)
12. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (84 points | 12 comments)
13. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (190 points | 24 comments)
14. Curl-Impersonate (395 points | 101 comments)
15. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (74 points | 22 comments)
16. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (90 points | 18 comments)
17. Why it's hard to trust software, but you mostly have to anyway (12 points | 7 comments)
18. Orbit by Mozilla (224 points | 219 comments)
19. Reverse Engineering the Duco Connectivity Board (21 points | 2 comments)
20. LineageOS 22 Released (160 points | 62 comments)
21. Agentarium: Creating social simulations with AI Agents (3 points | discuss)
22. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (53 points | 1 comment)
23. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (200 points | 95 comments)
24. Performance of LLMs on Advent of Code 2024 (85 points | 49 comments)
25. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (922 points | 77 comments)
26. Coding Font Selection 'Tournament' (70 points | 57 comments)
27. I made a tiny library for switches and sum types in Lua (40 points | 5 comments)
28. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (190 points | 55 comments)
29. The Homa Network Protocol (90 points | 14 comments)
30. Experimenting with architectures for video games inspired by tabletop games (16 points | 4 comments)
